column4: not sure I like having so many packages installed by default.... I like being able to select a more basic start and build from there
get the server
well, I wanted the desktop enviroment but not things like gimp and open office (though I would install those personally)
you might want to go with another distro
you should try arch
well, I like the idea of having a broad user base and there for more prebuilt packages availible
there are 9000 prebuilt packages in the repositories and thousands more the the user repository
you talking about ubuntu right?
arch
and by comparison how many are there in ubuntu?
it installs base system, you use binary package manager to get whatever else
its hard to compare because ubuntu separates headers into different packages
so nearly every package has another -dev package, whereas arch just puts them together like sane people, so ubuntu really has about half of what it would show
but I would imagine with the user base that ubuntu has it must have the biggest repos of binaries
last time I checked it had 18,000 or so, which you cut in half and you are right around the same, also have to recognize the existence of quite a few meta packages which fill up even more space
I'm definitely going to check it out
kernel is the only thing that ever requires reboot
word
I can read, thanks.
right... and so when I suggest that the bot might be a little too sensative it warrants repeating to me what the bot already said?!
how is that not the same attitude thing?
apparently I was wrong... the floodbot isn't sensative enough... it hasn't kicked you out yet.
